title: Ripple Expands To Portugal With Unic√¢mbio Partnership
body: Ripple disclosed a new partnership with Portuguese currency exchange provider Unic√¢mbio today. The collaboration, announced on February 10, 2025, will extend the company‚Äôs crypto-enabled payments solution to Portugal for the first time‚Äîparticularly aimed at facilitating more seamless transactions between Portuguese and Brazilian markets. Ripple Teams Up With Unic√¢mbio Via X, the company announced : ‚ÄúPlanting the Ripple flag in Portugal today with Unic√¢mbio, our first Portuguese client and the country‚Äôs leading currency exchange provider! Using Ripple Payments, their corporate customers can now move funds nearly instantly between Portugal and Brazil.‚Äù In the official press release, Ripple, which describes itself as the ‚Äúleading provider of digital asset infrastructure for financial institutions,‚Äù will deploy its Payments platform, leveraging digital assets to streamline cross-border payments between Portugal and Brazil . According to the announcement, Unic√¢mbio‚Äôs corporate customers stand to benefit immediately from near-instant settlement and reduced costs‚Äîan especially salient advantage in a corridor with robust economic and cultural ties. ‚ÄúOur partnership with Unic√¢mbio is a significant milestone in Ripple‚Äôs European expansion. Portugal has developed a thriving crypto ecosystem so we are delighted to open up our payments solution to partners there,‚Äù said Cassie Craddock, Managing Director, UK & Europe, at Ripple. ‚ÄúBy connecting our payment networks in Portugal and Brazil we are facilitating faster, more cost-effective cross-border payments, while strengthening the economic bridge between these two major markets. Ripple has over a decade of experience of tokenising real-world assets , starting with bringing fiat currencies onchain to seamlessly send money across borders.‚Äù The company has previously established a prominent presence in Brazil through partnerships with Travelex Bank, operational since 2022, and Mercado Bitcoin‚ÄîLatin America‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange‚Äîwhich joined Ripple‚Äôs network late last year. With this latest move, the fintech deepens its focus on international expansion within Europe by tapping the Portuguese market‚Äôs growing appetite for digital asset solutions. ‚ÄúPortugal and Brazil share deep economic and cultural ties, with significant money flows between the two countries,‚Äù noted Adriana Jer√≥nimo, Executive Board Member at Unic√¢mbio. ‚ÄúBy leveraging blockchain technology we‚Äôre transforming money movement between the two nations. Ripple‚Äôs crypto-enabled payments solution enables near-instant settlement and drastically reduces costs compared to traditional payments channels, delivering real value to our customers.‚Äù According to the announcement, the company is positioned to offer core services that financial institutions need for tokenizing, storing, exchanging, and moving digital assets securely and in full compliance. Currently covering 90+ payout markets‚Äîrepresenting over 90% of daily foreign exchange volume‚Äîthe Payments platform has reportedly processed in excess of $70 billion in volume to date. The firm also cites 60+ regulatory licenses and registrations across various jurisdictions, adding a layer of regulatory assurance for its financial partners. At press time, XRP traded at $2.43.

title: CoinShares Files for XRP and Litecoin ETFs with Nasdaq, SEC Reviews 19b-4 Forms
body: CoinShares has filed applications with Nasdaq for the listing and trading of exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on XRP and Litecoin. Nasdaq has submitted 19b-4 forms to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to list the CoinShares XRP ETF and CoinShares Litecoin ETF, marking a significant move towards integrating cryptocurrencies into mainstream investment vehicles. The proposed ETFs aim to provide investors with exposure to XRP and Litecoin without the need to directly purchase the cryptocurrencies. This development comes amidst growing institutional interest in cryptocurrencies, despite ongoing legal uncertainties surrounding XRP's classification as a security. title: Dave Portnoy‚Äôs Jailstool crashes by over 1000% in 1 hour after 2,600,000% gain yesterday
body: Dave Portnoy‚Äôs beloved meme coin, Jailstool, fell off a cliff today, crashing over 1000% in a brutal one-hour wipeout even after he kept posting about it and reiterating his promise to not sell until market cap reaches $1 billion. Less than a day after Dave hyped the token through non-stop tweets and an X Space session with 3.5 million followers, Jailstool‚Äôs price tanked from $0.15 to $0.08, and its market cap (which surged to $220 million overnight) now stands at a dismal $35 million, according to data from CoinGecko. From meme coin glory to disaster The madness kicked off when Dave tweeted that if Jailstool could hit #1 on X‚Äôs trending list within 20 minutes, he would stay up all night promoting it. ‚ÄúIf not, I‚Äôm going to bed,‚Äù he warned. Crypto traders took him seriously. They flooded the platform, spammed the hashtag, and got it trending in no time. Dave kept his promise, staying online and hyping the coin like a man on a mission. ‚ÄúI was invited to SI Party, GQ party, 11 party, etc.,‚Äù he tweeted. ‚ÄúBut there‚Äôs no place I‚Äôd rather be than laying in bed in the dark right now pumping Jailstool.‚Äù With the hype machine running at full speed, the coin‚Äôs market cap exploded by 119,000% in just five hours, while its price skyrocketed by 2.6 million percent in 24 hours. But as fast as it went up, it came crashing down. By morning, the coin had lost over 1000% of its value, and traders were scrambling to make sense of the carnage. Yesterday during the mania, Dave revealed that a whale had bought between $7 million and $8 million worth of Jailstool. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fucking nuts,‚Äù Dave tweeted. ‚ÄúThey are now the largest coinholder. Welcome?! Is this good? Hopefully, he‚Äôs a good whale like Willy and not a d*ckhead whale.‚Äù Guess what? Yeah, he was a d*ckhead whale. Kraken listed Jailstool during the height of the hype, but that, too, failed to prevent the crash. ‚ÄúI put hundreds of thousands of my own money into Jailstool and promised up to $1 million more as it grew. I promised not to take any out till the market cap hit $1 billion,‚Äù Dave said during the crash. ‚ÄúI coulda cashed out for $6 million. I didn‚Äôt. But I‚Äôm not just gonna promote forever for free while sharks eat minnows. I‚Äôve done exactly what I promised to do, like I always do. 100% transparent.‚Äù The crash of course ignited a firestorm on social media, with traders blaming everything from Dave‚Äôs mixed signals to market manipulators. One user told Dave, ‚ÄúThe coin died because you said you‚Äôre still considering launching your own and that this was a learning experience. That told people this was temporary and Jailstool was not a long-term coin. I‚Äôm just being real with you.‚Äù Another trader said, ‚ÄúF*ck it, I just aped back in. We trust Dave.‚Äù The trust wasn‚Äôt universal, though. Critics pointed out that Dave‚Äôs constant mentions of launching another coin spooked investors and triggered the sell-off. One suggestion gained traction among traders: Dave should drop a portion of any new coin he creates directly to Jailstool holders. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a win-win and allows both to do well. Instant distribution to 100,000 holders,‚Äù one user said. Despite the crash, Dave insisted he wasn‚Äôt abandoning the project. ‚ÄúFacts,‚Äù he replied to a supportive comment. ‚ÄúRegardless of what I do, I will continue to root for Jailstool and honor every commitment I made. If it goes to a $200 million market cap again, I‚Äôll dump $100k into it. I won‚Äôt sell a dime till $1 billion. I‚Äôm still holding it all. Coulda sold at $6 million. Didn‚Äôt. Just not gonna break my ass so sharks can profit off me.‚Äù But even with his reassurance, the community was divided. Some blamed KOLs (key opinion leaders) for shorting Jailstool into oblivion. User Chrissy suggested that Dave secretly buys up the supply and declares Jailstool his official coin. ‚ÄúIf you want a MAJOR short squeeze, why don‚Äôt you secretly buy up the supply, then claim this as the official coin and you‚Äôll get your billions plus more!!‚Äù Gigi, another supporter, praised Dave‚Äôs transparency and vision. ‚ÄúWhile there is an aggressive rotator‚Äôs market right now, we see what you‚Äôre doing and how you‚Äôre trying to do it the right way. You have my full support on making this the token that helps the normies onboard. We need more people like you here,‚Äù she said. At press time, jailstool was worth $0.32, down over 3000% in the past twenty-four hours. Cryptopolitan Academy: Are You Making These Web3 Resume Mistakes? - Find Out Here

title: Ethereum, ONDO and Coldware: 3 Cryptocurrencies Positioned For Exhilarating Gains In 2025
body: Ethereum (ETH) has long been the foundation of the blockchain ecosystem, but new challengers like Ondo Finance (ONDO) and Coldware (COLD) are gaining traction, offering unique solutions for scalability, institutional adoption, and real-world blockchain applications. As market sentiment remains volatile, these three cryptocurrencies are positioned for substantial growth in 2025. Coldware‚Äôs IoT Blockchain Poised for Explosive Growth Unlike Ethereum and Ondo Finance (ONDO), Coldware (COLD) is pioneering a new frontier by integrating IoT devices with blockchain technology. Using a multi-layered Proof-of-Stake (PoS) model, Coldware offers high-speed transactions with near-zero fees, making it an ideal choice for supply chain automation, smart cities, and enterprise blockchain adoption. Ethereum struggles with high gas fees and network congestion, while Coldware (COLD) ‚Äòs network is built to process transactions instantly, without the need for Layer-2 scaling solutions. This makes it a superior option for businesses looking for cost-effective blockchain integration. As Coldware gains traction, early investors are positioning themselves ahead of its full-scale launch, with the presale already attracting significant capital from institutional players. Ethereum‚Äôs Road to $5,000 Faces Key Resistance Ethereum has shown resilience despite ongoing market corrections and competition from newer Layer-1 blockchains. The ETH price has fluctuated around $3,250, with resistance at $3,344 acting as a major hurdle. Institutional demand for Ethereum ETFs has surged, with over $420 million in inflows over the past week, but whale activity suggests profit-taking. Meanwhile, ETH‚Äôs high transaction fees and reliance on Layer-2 solutions continue to push developers and investors toward alternative blockchain networks. If Ethereum can break through its resistance levels, analysts predict a potential rally to $5,000, but the competition from innovative projects like Coldware (COLD) and Ondo Finance (ONDO) is growing stronger. ONDO: The Institutional Bridge for Real-World Assets (RWAs) Ondo Finance (ONDO) has positioned itself as a key player in the tokenization of real-world assets (RWAs), offering a Layer-1 blockchain specifically designed for institutional-grade DeFi applications. With increasing network activity and whale accumulation, Ondo Finance (ONDO) has shown strong performance despite market volatility. The recent launch of the Ondo Chain has further strengthened its institutional appeal, making it an attractive option for investors looking for exposure to regulated, institutional-focused blockchain solutions. Ondo Finance‚Äôs (ONDO) price has remained stable above $1.18, and if demand continues, analysts predict a breakout toward $1.60 and beyond as the RWA sector expands. Final Thoughts: The Best Crypto Opportunities in 2025 Ethereum remains a cornerstone of the blockchain ecosystem, but ONDO and Coldware are emerging as serious contenders, each offering unique advantages for institutional investors and real-world adoption. With Ethereum battling resistance levels, Ondo Finance (ONDO) expanding the RWA sector, and Coldware (COLD) introducing a next-gen IoT blockchain, these three cryptocurrencies are set to be some of the best-performing assets in 2025.For more information on the Coldware (COLD) Presale: Visit Coldware (COLD) Join and become a community member: https://t.me/coldwarenetwork https://x.com/ColdwareNetwork Continue Reading: Ethereum, ONDO and Coldware: 3 Cryptocurrencies Positioned For Exhilarating Gains In 2025

title: Binance‚Äôs Latest Reserves Report Contains Unprecedented Changes ‚Äì Did the Exchange Take a Position Based on Market Conditions?
body: According to the latest Proof of Reserves (PoR) report of cryptocurrency exchange Binance, the exchange may have sold a large amount of its excess cryptocurrency assets. Binance still holds all of the assets that users normally own, but according to the previous report, the exchange had a large amount of cryptocurrencies, while the new report shows that they have largely been sold. The main changes in the exchange's reserves are as follows: He Sold Almost All of His $4 Billion in BTC Sold almost all of his $3 billion in USDT. He sold all of his $700 million in ETH. In total, he sold $8 billion of his $14 billion in extra assets. Let us remind you that the exchange still holds all the assets owned by the users. However, for example, while the ratio of BTCs owned by the exchange to users' BTCs in the previous report was 108%, this decreased to 100.45% in the new report. On the other hand, on the Ethereum side, this ratio decreased from around 104% to 100%. While similar declines were experienced for Solana and XRP, the same ratio in the stablecoin supply of the exchange showed a smaller decrease. You can access Binance's Proof of Reserves report here. *This is not investment advice. title: US Foundations and Universities Begin Accumulating Bitcoin Amid President Trump‚Äôs Crypto Promises: Report
body: President Donald Trump‚Äôs pro-crypto sentiment is reportedly fueling the accumulation of Bitcoin ( BTC ) by US charities and universities. According to a new report by The Financial Times, Trump‚Äôs promises to make the US a crypto powerhouse have triggered foundations and universities in the nation to gobble up the top crypto asset by market cap. Notable schools that are getting exposure to the flagship digital asset include the University of Austin and Emory University in Georgia. Meanwhile, the philanthropy group The Rockefeller Foundation is also mulling increasing its stash of crypto assets. Says Chun Lai, The Rockefeller Foundation‚Äôs CIO, ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have a crystal ball on how cryptocurrencies will become in 10 years. We don‚Äôt want to be left behind when their potential materializes dramatically‚Ä¶ The crypto space is associated with the artificial intelligence space and the level of digitization of the economy. [Cryptocurrencies] can be useful if the economy becomes more [digitized].‚Äù Chad Thevenot, senior vice president for advancement at the University of Austin, says the university views investing in crypto assets the same way it sees investing in other asset classes. ‚ÄúWe think there is long-term value there, just the same way that we might think there is long-term value in stocks or real estate.‚Äù The University of Austin ‚Äì which opened its doors just last year ‚Äì is raising a $5 million BTC fund. However, other universities such as the University of Nebraska, are taking a more heedful approach to digital assets. Brian Neale, CIO of the University of Nebraska Foundation, says that he does not plan to jump into Bitcoin and crypto until clear rules of the road are established and more of his counterparts decide to invest in the asset class. ‚ÄúI think this administration has the power to move things in that direction. But I don‚Äôt think just the president of the United States issuing his own cryptocurrency is really going to be the catalyst that it‚Äôs going to move things to the mainstream.‚Äù Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Algorand price to exit a 3-year consolidation: is a 400% surge coming?
body: Algorand price suffers sharp reversal as crypto sentiment weakens Algorand ( ALGO ), a pioneering layer-1 blockchain network, has dropped to $0.3, down by 53% from its highest level in December. The ongoing decline is largely attributed to worsening market sentiment in the crypto industry. The crypto fear and greed index has fallen from the extreme greed level of over 90 in early 2024 to the fear level of 35 today. Similarly, most altcoins are struggling, as reflected in the altcoin season index, which has dropped to 44. This downturn has also impacted the Algorand ecosystem, with investors staying on the sidelines. The total value locked in Algorand‚Äôs decentralized finance ecosystem has fallen from a December high of $244 million to $114 million today. It has also dropped in ALGO terms, moving from last year‚Äôs high of 1.73 billion ALGO to 412 million today. On the positive side, Nansen data shows that Algorand‚Äôs active addresses have risen by double digits in the past 30 days. The network recorded over 2.5 million active addresses, up 27% from the previous period. The number of transactions increased by 8.5% to 44.9 million. However, total fees collected over the last 30 days declined by 7.9% to just $52,300. You might also like: Scaramucci: Bitcoin price today is ‚Äòwhere it should have been in 2022‚Äô Algorand price analysis ALGO chart | Source: crypto.news The weekly chart shows that ALGO has been in a near three-year consolidation phase, trading within the support range of $0.0931 and $0.3360. It formed a triple-bottom pattern, with a neckline at $0.3360, a historically strong bullish indicator in technical analysis. Algorand has now developed a small falling wedge pattern and retested the support at $0.3360. A wedge pattern typically signals an upcoming strong bullish breakout. This formation is also part of the second wave of the Elliott Wave pattern. Therefore, the coin is likely to rebound as it enters the third phase, which is usually the longest and strongest in the Elliott Wave cycle. If this scenario plays out, the next target to watch will be $1.4571, the 50% Fibonacci retracement level, representing a potential 400% gain from the current price. However, a drop below the $0.20 support level would invalidate the bullish outlook. You might also like: GameStop shares gain 6% amid Bitcoin adoption rumors

title: Just In: Alabama Man Pleads Guilty in US SEC X Account Bitcoin ETF Hack, Here‚Äôs All
body: A 25-year-old Alabama man has admitted to his role in the hacking of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs (SEC) X account. The cyberattack led to a false announcement about Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), causing a brief price surge. Eric Council Jr Pleads Guilty in US SEC X Account Hack According to a Bloomberg report, an Alabama man Eric Council Jr. has pleaded guilty to charges related to the January 2024 SEC Bitcoin ETF hack. The case was heard in a Washington federal court, where Council admitted to conspiracy to commit aggravated identity theft and access device fraud. The hack involved posting a fake announcement on the SEC‚Äôs X account, formerly Twitter, falsely stating that the agency had approved Bitcoin ETFs. The post caused Bitcoin‚Äôs price to rise sharply before the SEC clarified that the information was false. The official approval of the ETFs came a day later. Prosecutors revealed that Eric Council Jr used a fake ID to deceive a phone store employee into granting access to the victim‚Äôs phone. This method, known as a SIM swap attack, allowed the hackers to bypass security measures and take control of the SEC‚Äôs social media account. This Is A Developing News, Please Check Back For More The post Just In: Alabama Man Pleads Guilty in US SEC X Account Bitcoin ETF Hack, Here‚Äôs All appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Several DeFi chains down 90+% since last cycle
body: North Korean hackers and shattered on-chain projects have left several decentralized finance blockchains struggling, with tens of millions in user asset outflows. Data from DefiLlama shows that multiple DeFi chains have lost around 90% of total user deposits over the years, particularly since the last crypto cycle.¬†On-chain analyst 0xThoor identified Ethereum Virtual Machine-compatible blockchain Harmony as the biggest drop regarding DeFi total value locked. Harmony launched its layer-1 mainnet in 2019, two years before the previous bull run and its 2021 peak. By January 2022, Harmony‚Äôs TVL reached an all-time high, surpassing $1.4 billion. Harmoney TVL down 99% | Source: DefiLlama Six months later, in June, North Korean hacker group Lazarus stole $100 million from Harmony‚Äôs Horizon bridge in one of DeFi‚Äôs largest hacks to date. Harmony‚Äôs user deposits steadily declined from that point. The protocol held $1.7 million in TVL by publishing time, down 99% from its 2022 ATH. You might also like: Strategy resumes Bitcoin plan with $742m buy DeFi TVL for projects like Aurora, Moonrise, Canto, and Evmos have also tumbled by at least 90%. Even Polygon, a popular Ethereum-based scaling solution, has lost 92% of its TVL. Crypto deposited on the L2 from $9.9 billion in 2021 to $700 million in early 2025. ‚ÄúMany more TVL charts will look like this over the coming years,‚Äù 0xThoor tweeted on Feb. 10. Total DeFi TVL currently hovers above $106 billion, down from $175 billion in 2025. Despite major protocol collapses, projects like Coinbase-incubated Base and emerging Bitcoin DeFi operability may propel the on-chain ecosystem to new heights as adoption accelerates. Read more: Brit Bitcoin miner weighs buying landfill to recover $768m

title: Pendle announces plans to target Solana, Hyperliquid and Ton
body: This is a segment from the 0xResearch newsletter. To read full editions, subscribe . Decentralized finance today is still largely an ouroboros , as Vitalik once pointed out. Protocol revenues and fees are real, and they prove the tech works. That is important! But these revenue flows are still largely the downstream result of speculative capital passing between traders in a circular, self-consuming cycle. Protocols like Pendle observed these state of affairs, declined to pass judgment, then simply built the best possible product to capitalize on this ouroboros-like economy. Want a fixed yield? Buy Pendle Principal Tokens (PT). Prefer to farm points with expectation of big airdrops? Buy Yield Tokens (YT). It‚Äôs as simple as that. What Pendle has created is not new. It‚Äôs the TradFi-equivalent of zero-coupon bonds, interest rate swaps or forward rate agreements. But Pendle has emulated these traditionally structured products extremely well in DeFi. In 2024, Pendle grew its TVL levels to $4.4 billion and daily average trading volumes to $96 million ‚Äî a 20x and 100x increase, respectively. Pendle is so successful that it has in effect become a de facto token launchpad akin to an ICO, but better. For instance, in the weeks leading up to Berachain‚Äôs genesis airdrop, Berachain Pendle markets accumulated more than a billion in TVL from users wanting to yield trade on Berachain assets and game airdrops. Pendle‚Äôs 2025 outlook Pendle co-founder TN Lee announced last week the protocol‚Äôs big plans for 2025. There are a host of minor piecemeal upgrades coming, like dynamic fees for yield trading and improvements to the vePENDLE token bribe system. But the most notable upgrade looks to Pendle‚Äôs plans to target the most lucrative yield source in crypto: perps funding rates. As part of this ‚ÄúBoros‚Äù (a play on ouroboros?) initiative, Pendle will allow traders to swap to yield trade perpetual funding rates. Source: Pendle This would enable protocols like Ethena to lock in predictable funding yields, which would entail fixed APYs for sUSDe holders. In hyper-volatile perps markets like memecoins, long traders will also be able to hedge against their perps positions by locking into a predictable, fixed funding rate. Pendle is also planning an expansion to non-EVM chains Solana, Hyperliquid and Ton. Solana already has a burgeoning yield-trading market, though it‚Äôs still small relative to Pendle. Finally, Pendle is coming for TradFi. The pitch is straightforward: ‚ÄúWhy stick with 8% yields on a 5-year corporate bond when you can enjoy a 17% WBTC PT yield?‚Äù This is part of the team‚Äôs plans to launch a KYC‚Äôd product for regulated entities as well as Islamic funds to access crypto yields. title: Hacker in SEC X account breach faces $50k fine in plea deal
body: Eric Council Jr., the man accused of helping to breach the X account of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, has pleaded guilty to the charges. As a result, Council faces a potential $50,000 fine as part of the plea deal, Bloomberg reported . U.S. authorities proposed the forfeiture of the $50k in a filing at the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia on Feb. 9.¬†The fine relates to what prosecutors say is an amount that Council ‚Äúpersonally obtained‚Äù amid the fake post on X, formerly Twitter, that alleged the SEC had approved the first spot Bitcoin ( BTC ) exchange-traded funds in the United States. Bitcoin price spiked sharply before plummeting as the agency confirmed its X account had been hacked. You might also like: US authorities indict Canadian national behind $65m KyberSwap, Indexed Finance hacks As crypto.news reported at the time, the FBI arrested Council in October 2024. Later that month, reports emerged that federal prosecutors were considering a plea deal offer. On Monday, Feb. 10, 2025, Eric Council Jr. pled guilty to one count of aggravated identity theft and device fraud. Judge Amy Berman Jackson has set the sentencing date to May 16, 2025. The SEC approved the spot ETFs a day after the hack, with the market interest seeing Blackock‚Äôs IBIT ETF dominate inflows as buying pressure ramped up. Over the year, the inflows hit over $40 billion, with the U.S. spot ETFs market closing 2024 with over $120 billion in net assets. Further developments at the SEC meanwhile saw the approval of spot Ethereum ( ETH ) ETFs in the U.S. The election of Donald Trump has also since seen a raft of resignations and exits at the agency, notably that of former chair Gary Gensler. Meanwhile, the industry has witnessed a flurry of activity in relation to new ETF applications, including for Litecoin, XRP, Solana and Dogecoin. title: Charles Hoskinson Slams USAID for Funding Book Linking Bitcoin to Extremism
body: The post Charles Hoskinson Slams USAID for Funding Book Linking Bitcoin to Extremism appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News In a latest development, Charles Hoskinson, founder of Cardano, has criticized the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) for funding a book that links Bitcoin to right-wing extremism. WikiLeaks recently revealed that USAID funded a book connecting Bitcoin and cyberlibertarianism to right-wing ideologies. The book, Cyberlibertarianism: The Right-Wing Politics of Digital Technology, authored by David Golumbia, links Bitcoin to extremist ideologies. Published by the University of Minnesota Press, it reportedly received over $80,000 in funding from the U.S. government, according to WikiLeaks. Hoskinson expressed his frustration on social media, calling this portrayal of Bitcoin ‚Äúgarbage.‚Äù So apparently, USAID is funding the production of propaganda that says Bitcoin is right-wing extremism. I'm so done with this garbage https://t.co/hG9ViJiW0A ‚Äî Charles Hoskinson (@IOHK_Charles) February 10, 2025 This controversy arises amid broader scrutiny of USAID‚Äôs activities. The Trump administration has recently issued an executive order leading to a funding freeze for the agency, affecting its global humanitarian efforts. Reports indicate that some USAID staff are also on leave, with the agency‚Äôs future unclear. Backing, Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson, Representative French Hill, chairman of the House Financial Services Committee (HFSC), recently commented on USAID‚Äôs spending. He mentioned that Elon Musk‚Äôs Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is looking into the agency‚Äôs budget. Hill also pointed out that Secretary of State Mike Rubio, who oversees USAID, will be involved in decisions about its future funding. Hoskinson‚Äôs criticism highlights the ongoing debate about how Bitcoin is portrayed and the role of government funding in crypto research. Bitcoin supporters argue that these narratives try to undermine decentralized technologies, which they see as tools for financial inclusion and economic freedom.

title: Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy Continues Bitcoin Buying Spree, Taking Total Holdings To 478,740 BTC
body: Software company Strategy is pushing forward with its Bitcoin buying spree in 2025. After a week-long pause, Strategy today announced that it had snapped up $742 million worth of the orange coin. The fresh purchase comes just days after the Bitcoin treasury company rebranded from ‚ÄúMicroStrategy‚Äù last week. Strategy Adds $742 Million To Its Bitcoin Treasury Strategy CEO Michael Saylor announced Monday that the company had acquired roughly 7,633 Bitcoin between Feb. 3 and Feb. 9. An SEC filing shows that Strategy spent $742.4 million buying the BTC stash at an average price of $97,255 per coin. Strategy now holds 478,740 BTC in total. Today‚Äôs BTC price is $97,279, which is a cache worth approximately $46 billion. All told, the firm acquired its coins at an average price of $65,033 per coin, the announcement said. $MSTR has acquired 7,633 BTC for ~$742.4 million at ~$97,255 per bitcoin and has achieved BTC Yield of 4.1% YTD 2025. As of 2/09/2025, @Strategy holds 478,740 $BTC acquired for ~$31.1 billion at ~$65,033 per bitcoin. https://t.co/rIftxRX2Zr ‚Äî Michael Saylor (@saylor) February 10, 2025 Similarly to Strategy‚Äôs previous Bitcoin buys, the company purchased its latest Bitcoin tranche using proceeds from the issuance and sale of shares under a convertible notes sales agreement. Strategy sold an aggregate of 516,413 shares of its Class A common stock last week, generating roughly $179 million in net proceeds. The company had around $4.17 billion of shares remaining for issuance and sale as of Feb. 9. Tysons, Virginia-based Strategy last year unveiled an ambitious ‚Äú21/21 Plan‚Äù to raise $42 billion to purchase Bitcoin. The plan means the company will raise $21 billion through equity, with another $21 billion coming by selling fixed-income securities. In December, Strategy made a grand foray into the Nasdaq-100 , an index of the top 100 non-financial firms on the Nasdaq stock market, alongside tech titans like Apple and Microsoft. Earlier this month, the company announced it had finalized the price of its new stock, dubbed STRK, which it will use to raise funds to amass even more Bitcoin for its treasury. Strategy‚Äôs moves come as multiple U.S. states field proposals to create Bitcoin reserves , while digital asset proponents are calling for other local governments to do the same.

title: Bitcoin Nosedives Below $98K ‚Äì Will Trump‚Äôs Tariffs Send it Lower?
body: Bitcoin‚Äôs price has plunged below the $98,000 mark, hovering around $96,550, as concerns grow over former US President Donald Trump‚Äôs plan to impose a 25% tariff on steel and aluminum imports. This move echoes his recent tariff announcements on Canada and Mexico, fueling fears of a global trade war that could impact financial markets, including cryptocurrencies. If selling pressure continues, Bitcoin could test the previous low of $91,000. Analysts warn that a break below the critical $93,000 support level could trigger liquidations worth $1.3 billion in leveraged long positions, exacerbating the decline. title: XRP Rally Imminent? 73% of Traders Go Long
body: The post XRP Rally Imminent? 73% of Traders Go Long appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News XRP, the native token of Ripple Labs, is gaining notable attention from traders despite ongoing market uncertainty, making it appear more bullish compared to other assets. Today, February 10, 2025, the overall cryptocurrency market is showing signs of price recovery, and traders seem to be finding better opportunities in the XRP token. 73% of Binance‚Äôs XRP Traders Go Long These traders were observed on Binance, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange. According to the data, the Binance XRPUSDT long/short ratio stands at 2.66, indicating that for every 2.66 long positions, Binance has only a single short position. This shows a bullish sentiment among traders. Source: Coinglass However, data further revealed that currently, 73% of top XRP traders on Binance hold long positions, while 27% hold short positions. This data not only shows strong interest from traders but also indicates attraction from long-term holders and whales. $12.50 Million Worth of XRP Outflow In addition to traders betting on the long side, investors and long-term holders have been found accumulating XRP tokens from exchanges. Data from the spot inflow/outflow reveals that exchanges across the crypto landscape have witnessed an outflow of a significant $12.50 million worth of XRP tokens. This substantial outflow from exchanges hints at potential accumulation and could lead to buying pressure and further upside momentum. XRP Price and Upcoming Level With all this participation from traders and investors, XRP‚Äôs trading volume jumped by 48% compared to the previous day. Despite the ups and downs in market uncertainty, XRP is still in an uptrend and is receiving support from the ascending trendline. Source: Trading View However, this marks the fourth day of consolidation near this level. Based on the recent price action and historical patterns, if XRP holds above the $2.30 level, there is a strong possibility it could soar by 35% to reach the $3.30 level in the future.

title: Will XRP Continue Bullish Momentum? XRP Investors Diversify Into New IoT Blockchain Solution
body: Ripple (XRP) has remained a focal point in the crypto market due to its speed, low transaction costs, and institutional adoption. However, recent whale sell-offs and regulatory uncertainties have prompted investors to explore alternative blockchain projects. One of the most promising alternatives gaining attention is Coldware (COLD) , an IoT-powered blockchain solution designed to enhance DeFi, tokenization, and real-world asset management. With XRP‚Äôs price volatility creating uncertainty, many investors are moving into Coldware, recognizing its potential as a next-generation blockchain network. But will this shift impact XRP‚Äôs long-term bullish momentum? XRP‚Äôs Market Struggles Amid Whale Sell-Offs XRP‚Äôs price recently saw a short-term rally, gaining 6% to reach $2.43. However, despite this bullish movement, traders remain cautious due to persistent whale sell-offs and regulatory pressures. XRP‚Äôs underlying technology and partnerships with financial institutions remain strong, but investors are concerned about its long-term stability. The SEC‚Äôs ongoing scrutiny of Ripple, combined with Ripple (XRP) whales offloading large positions, has led to price volatility that has made some traders hesitant to hold long-term positions. Market analysts suggest that while Ripple (XRP) could still see gains in 2025, its growth may be slower compared to emerging blockchain solutions that offer enhanced scalability and real-world integration. This is where Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) has entered the conversation, offering a more dynamic alternative for investors looking to diversify. Coldware: The Rising Alternative for Blockchain Utility Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) IoT-powered blockchain solution provides a decentralized infrastructure that enhances asset tracking, smart contract automation, and on-chain verification. Unlike XRP, which focuses primarily on cross-border payments, Coldware extends blockchain applications to logistics, supply chain management, and industrial automation. By enabling real-world asset tokenization with built-in IoT compatibility, Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) ensures that transactions are not only secure but also verifiable in real-time. This innovation has positioned it as a strong alternative for investors seeking exposure to blockchain technology with broader applications beyond financial transactions. Why XRP Investors Are Moving to Coldware The transition of Ripple (XRP) investors into Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) is driven by several key factors: Regulatory Uncertainty ‚Äì XRP‚Äôs legal battles continue to create uncertainty for institutional and retail investors. Coldware (COLD) , as a new blockchain project, operates outside of this regulatory scrutiny, making it a more attractive option. Scalability and Utility ‚Äì Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) ‚Äôs IoT-powered blockchain enables seamless integration with physical assets, providing a tangible use case beyond XRP‚Äôs payment processing capabilities. Growth Potential ‚Äì While Ripple (XRP) has already established its market position, Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) is in its early growth stage. Investors see an opportunity for higher returns as the project gains adoption. Could XRP and Coldware Coexist? Despite the migration of some Ripple (XRP) investors to Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) , both projects serve different purposes in the blockchain ecosystem. XRP remains a key player in cross-border payments, while Coldware‚Äôs IoT-focused infrastructure caters to broader industrial and financial applications. The two blockchains could coexist, with Ripple (XRP) continuing to dominate the remittance sector while Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) expands into logistics, asset tracking, and decentralized automation. However, if XRP‚Äôs regulatory issues persist, Coldware‚Äôs superior technology could position it as a preferred investment choice for blockchain enthusiasts. Conclusion Ripple‚Äôs (XRP) bullish momentum faces significant hurdles, with whale sell-offs and legal uncertainty creating volatility. As a result, many investors are diversifying into Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) , recognizing its potential to disrupt multiple industries with IoT-powered blockchain solutions. While XRP remains a leading payment-focused cryptocurrency, Coldware‚Äôs ability to tokenize and track real-world assets in real-time makes it a strong alternative for investors looking beyond financial transactions. As both projects continue to evolve, it will be interesting to see whether Coldware (COLD) can establish itself as a dominant force in the blockchain space, potentially challenging XRP‚Äôs market position in the long run. title: Pro: North Carolina‚Äôs Strategic Bitcoin Reserve bill a ‚Äòbig deal‚Äô
body: North Carolina has joined a growing list of states seeking to legalize digital currencies, but according to Dan Spuller, this effort stands apart from the rest. More than a dozen U.S. states have introduced legislation to permit holding Bitcoin ( BTC ) as a strategic reserve. North Carolina is the latest to join the push with the introduction of HB 92. The bill would allow state lawmakers to invest up to 10% of the state‚Äôs funds into exchange-traded products tied to digital assets with a market capitalization exceeding $750 billion. It also authorizes Bitcoin investments for state-managed funds, including teachers‚Äô and state employees‚Äô pensions, insurance funds, and veterans‚Äô home trust funds. Read more: Illinois may become first U.S. state with an official Bitcoin Reserve What makes North Carolina‚Äôs bill unique is that it was introduced by Rep. Destin Hall, Speaker of the NC House of Representatives. As noted by Dan Spuller, Head of Industry Affairs at the Blockchain Association, Hall is ‚Äúone of NC‚Äôs most powerful leaders.‚Äù As promised, North Carolina‚Äôs Strategic Bitcoin Reserve legislation was introduced today. This is a big deal. Let me explain: üìú HB 92 bill was personally introduced by House Speaker @DestinHall ‚Äîone of NC‚Äôs most powerful leaders. Top of the food chain. It will directly‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/QtS6Kj8CKu ‚Äî Dan Spuller (@DanSpuller) February 10, 2025 The bill is co-sponsored by Representatives Mark Brody and Steve Ross, described by Spuller as ‚Äúlongtime Bitcoin champions.‚Äù Spuller revealed in an X post in late January that he advised North Carolina officials on the bill. At the time, he noted that the process was ‚Äúmoving quickly, and most importantly, the right stakeholders are aligning.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis won‚Äôt just be a ‚Äòmessaging bill‚Äô‚Äîit‚Äôs a plan in motion,‚Äù he added. title: Injective brings largest publicly traded stocks on-chain with new TradFi index
body: Injective is taking another step toward narrowing the gap between traditional finance and decentralized finance by bringing stocks of the largest publicly traded companies on-chain. The layer-1 blockchain has introduced the TradFi Stocks Index, an on-chain index that will track some of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded companies, including Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs. Injective ( INJ ), which recently unveiled an index combining top artificial intelligence stocks and tokens, sees the TradFi index as a new era for global finance. ‚ÄúThis launch of the TradFi index is a major step toward our vision of democratizing access to financial markets,‚Äù said Eric Chen, chief executive officer and co-founder, Injective Labs. ‚ÄúFor the first time, users can engage with the largest publicly traded equities on-chain in an entirely decentralized manner, free from traditional market constraints.‚Äù You might also like: Polkadot launches JAM course to empower web3 developers The on-chain index will allow users to track hundreds of publicly listed stocks, offering a decentralized trading experience for equities. Access will be available through a single integrated product, which will be featured on Injective‚Äôs leading decentralized exchange, Helix. Key features of the TradFi index include 24/7 trading and up to 25x leverage. The launch of the equities index on Helix follows Injective‚Äôs rollout of the AI Index Perpetual Market, with ticker AIX, on the DEX. A few days later and the new era of finance continues with the TradFi Stock Index, which is a milestone that follows a governance vote for the launch of the first on-chain S&P 500 Index. ‚ÄúBy bringing the most sought after traditional finance markets on-chain, we‚Äôre not just creating a new trading product; we‚Äôre redefining what‚Äôs possible in decentralized finance,‚Äù Chen added. While the stocks index will offer access to global giants in the equities market, AIX brings a product that puts together AI tokens and NVIDIA, Taiwan Semiconductor and other AI stocks. In the crypto market, Injective, ai16z, Bittensor and Virtuals Protocol. You might also like: io.net and Injective join forces to power DeFAI

title: John Deaton Calls Out Stellar (XLM) Over Criticism of Ripple and XRP
body: Attorney John Deaton, a vocal advocate for digital asset holders, recently addressed a tweet from ‚ÄúBuild on Stellar‚Äù that criticized Ripple for spending more on legal fees than on development. The tweet , which read, ‚ÄúImagine spending more on lawyers than developers and calling it progress,‚Äù appeared to take aim at Ripple‚Äôs ongoing legal battle with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Deaton responded by pointing out what he saw as a major contradiction in the situation. He referenced a co-founder of Ripple, widely understood to be Jed McCaleb, who has publicly distanced himself from the company but profited greatly from XRP sales. Imagine a founder publicly taking shots at the company he co-founded, after the company was targeted by the @SECGov , likely with his help, for spending $150 million in legal fees because the SEC said it was illegal for that company to have sold $1.3 billion in XRP sales. Now‚Ä¶ https://t.co/mCvTVnxkHB ‚Äî John E Deaton (@JohnEDeaton1) February 8, 2025 While Ripple was forced to spend $150 million in legal fees to defend itself against the SEC‚Äôs allegations that its XRP sales violated securities laws, McCaleb reportedly made $2 billion from selling the asset‚Äîafter the lawsuit was filed and while his former company was under attack. The Controversy Surrounding Jed McCaleb‚Äôs XRP Sales McCaleb, who left Ripple in 2013 and later founded Stellar, has continued selling large amounts of XRP. His structured settlement with Ripple let him sell portions of his holdings gradually. However, the timing of these sales‚Äîespecially during the SEC lawsuit‚Äîhas led to criticism from many in the XRP community. Ripple‚Äôs legal battle with the SEC has had significant financial and reputational consequences for the company and its executives, particularly CEO Brad Garlinghouse and Executive Chairman Chris Larsen. The case has broader implications for the entire digital asset industry, challenging how cryptocurrencies are classified and regulated in the United States. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Deaton‚Äôs remarks underscored the frustration among Ripple supporters, who view McCaleb‚Äôs detachment from the lawsuit as unfair. While Ripple has fought a costly legal battle that could shape the future of crypto regulation, McCaleb remained uninvolved while profiting from the very asset under scrutiny. Ongoing Debate Within the Crypto Community The exchange between Deaton and Build on Stellar sparked further discussion about whether McCaleb should be held accountable for his role in Ripple‚Äôs history. One user questioned whether Build on Stellar was merely a neutral ‚Äúbuilders account‚Äù rather than an entity taking direct shots at Ripple. Deaton clarified that while he was not accusing McCaleb of running the account, he believes that if someone makes statements about another person, they should tag them for transparency. Another commenter argued that McCaleb should recognize the contributions of those at Ripple fighting against what they see as unjust regulatory enforcement. Figures like Garlinghouse and Ripple‚Äôs Chief Technology Officer, David Schwartz, have been at the forefront of the industry‚Äôs battle against the SEC, earning respect within the crypto community. The debate highlights the lingering divisions between supporters of Ripple and Stellar, as well as the broader frustrations over regulatory enforcement and internal conflicts within the blockchain industry. As the SEC case against Ripple unfolds, discussions like these will likely persist, reflecting the deep tensions surrounding XRP‚Äôs legal and financial history. title: XRP, ONDO & Coldware: XRP Unveils New Partnership With Ondo Finance Could Surge XRP's Price
body: Ripple‚Äôs XRP has long been a major player in the crypto space, particularly in the cross-border payment industry. However, its latest partnership with Ondo Finance (ONDO) is drawing fresh attention to the asset‚Äôs potential in the tokenized real-world asset (RWA) market. With Ondo Finance launching Ondo Finance (ONDO), a blockchain solution built to tokenize traditional assets like stocks and bonds, Ripple (XRP) is aligning itself with a project that could redefine institutional finance. At the same time, Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) is emerging as another key player in the IoT-powered blockchain industry. With its decentralized infrastructure designed for smart contracts, staking, and secure hardware integration, Coldware (COLD) is becoming an attractive option for investors diversifying within the crypto sector. Could this new partnership with Ondo Finance (ONDO) push Ripple (XRP) to new highs, and how does Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) fit into the equation? XRP and Ondo Finance: A Strategic Partnership for Institutional Growth Ondo Finance (ONDO) has positioned itself as a bridge between traditional finance and blockchain technology. With the introduction of Ondo Chain, it aims to provide an institutional-grade blockchain for tokenizing U.S. public securities, allowing real-world financial assets to be brought on-chain. XRP, already an established leader in global payments, stands to benefit from this partnership by enhancing its own ecosystem with new financial use cases. The ability to tokenize securities and trade them efficiently on-chain aligns with Ripple‚Äôs vision of integrating crypto into mainstream financial markets. With institutional finance moving toward tokenized assets, the partnership with Ondo Finance could allow Ripple (XRP) to expand its influence beyond remittances and into broader capital markets. Coldware‚Äôs Role in the Expanding Blockchain Ecosystem While Ripple (XRP) and Ondo Finance (ONDO)focus on institutional finance, Coldware (COLD) is establishing itself as a next-generation blockchain solution with IoT integrations and decentralized staking mechanisms. Unlike traditional blockchains, Coldware (COLD) enables direct communication between smart contracts and real-world IoT devices, ensuring security and efficiency for automated transactions. Investors are increasingly turning to Coldware‚Äôs (COLD) as an alternative to large-scale projects like XRP due to its practical applications in supply chain management, logistics, and industrial automation. title: Ripple's First Foray Into Portugal: Partners With Unic√¢mbio Using Blockchain for Instant Cross-Border Payments
body: Ripple has expanded its European presence by partnering with Unic√¢mbio, a leading currency exchange provider in Portugal, to facilitate instant cross-border payments between Portugal and Brazil. This collaboration marks Ripple's first foray into the Portuguese market, leveraging Ripple Payments to enable Unic√¢mbio's corporate clients to transfer funds quickly and efficiently between the two countries. The partnership aims to enhance the financial connectivity between Portugal and Brazil, utilizing blockchain technology to reduce processing delays and operational friction. title: CrossFi Launches Interchain Protocol EXE to Accelerate AI Agents
body: San Francisco, United States, February 10th, 2025, Chainwire DeFi ecosystem CrossFi has announced the launch of EXE, a new protocol designed to accelerate AI and web3 innovation. Billed as the first interchain AI utility protocol, EXE goes live on February 11 with a native $EXE token to power network activity. To kickstart the launch of EXE, CrossFi has allocated tokens to the Plex community at a special rate of $0.001, allowing 1 $PLEX to be exchanged for 10 $EXE. Tokens will be claimable from February 11, enabling Plex members to begin exploring opportunities on EXE‚Äôs protocol. Designed to support a host of AI-related services, including decentralized GPU compute, AI dapps, and autonomous agents, EXE will drive novel applications operating at the intersection of DeFi and AI. Onchain AI development is currently fragmented across multiple chains, each optimized for a specific use case. EXE has been designed to aggregate this activity, enabling dapps to seamlessly collaborate, pay for GPU power from multiple sources, and coordinate tasks among themselves. Using EXE, AI developers can register their dapp, describe its functions, and then let the network‚Äôs smart contracts handle matchmaking, service discovery, and payments. Dapps can chain their specialized skills together, driving lower GPU costs and an agent-friendly environment where agents can discover each other via EXE‚Äôs knowledge graph. By merging CrossFi‚Äôs established L1 blockchain with a dedicated AI utility token, EXE aims to create an AI ecosystem that‚Äôs cost-effective, agent-friendly, and ready for mass adoption. Built on CrossFi‚Äôs L1, which integrates EVM and Cosmos seamlessly, EXE provides opportunities for network users to earn rewards as human contributors for tasks such as data labeling and providing specialized reviews. A number of advanced technologies have been incorporated into EXE‚Äôs interchain protocol including zk-proofs for M2M (machine-to-machine) transactions, ensuring both data confidentiality and transaction integrity. This will ensure a secure environment where AI agents can collaborate or pay for GPU resources without exposing proprietary information to the network. Through combining M2M operations between dapps and agents with micro-tasks that human operators can perform, EXE will develop a thriving economy that rewards work directly in the form of $EXE. This includes supporting more complex tasks, such as code reviews or creative design, creating a crowd-sourced layer of human intelligence within an agent-driven system. Set to go live with an estimated market cap of $100M, EXE will reinforce CrossFi‚Äôs reputation as a hub for innovative blockchain projects that push the boundaries of decentralized technology. In the process, it will empower DeFi users to discover the opportunities autonomous agents present to learn and earn. About CrossFi CrossFi Chain provides an inclusive, next-generation solution that bridges fiat and cryptocurrency seamlessly. Featuring innovative non-custodial payment technology, CrossFi enables users to maintain full control of their funds while enjoying unparalleled access, transparency, and convenience. CrossFi brings true financial freedom and inclusivity for all. title: Pepe Investors Panic as Prices Drop ‚Äì Is a Total Collapse Near?
body: Pepe (PEPE) investors are in a state of panic as the pullback from early December highs above $0.000028 deepens, and the threat of a total market capitulation rises. The Pepe price was last just below $0.000010, a drop of more than 65% from December‚Äôs peak, with the bulk of the decline coming since US President Trump launched his meme coin just before his election. This meme coin launch by the President dealt a devastating blow to the meme coin space, with most tokens down significantly since its launch. "I know I launched it and it was successful" Trump acknowledging he launched his $TRUMP memecoin and that it is actually his there is the official confirmation everyone was waiting for pic.twitter.com/YWeLnLlVAT ‚Äî AshRobin (@ashrobinqt) January 21, 2025 TRUMP appeared to have sucked up a significant amount of liquidity in the space, including from new crypto investors who might have otherwise been tempted to buy into pre-existing meme coins like PEPE. Moreover, the Trump meme coin launch marked significant dilution in the meme coin space, and could act as a green light for a wave new token launches from all sort of big names, brands and celebrities, leading to further dilution. Total Capitulation Incoming? Pepe technicals also tell a bearish story. The meme coins abrupt collapse in recent weeks has seen it fall below all of its major moving averages, as well as key support at $0.000017, $0.000013 and $0.000011. Its even broken below an uptrend from its August lows. All said, a retest of last summer‚Äôs lows in the $0.000006 area look very possible. A break below here could open the door to a total capitulation all the way back 2023/early 2024 levels under $0.000002. For those who believe the US President dealt a death blow to meme coins might want to exit before things go from bad to worse. Of course, that‚Äôs the extremely bearish case. Much more likely is that major meme coins like Pepe enjoy some sort of comeback in 2025/2026, assuming broader crypto adoption continues and financial conditions ease. Anyone can launch a new meme coin token, but achieving the level of community and investor devotion enjoyed by big meme coins like Pepe is a very difficult feat. Best Meme Coin to Buy to Ride Market Recovery Assuming tokens like Pepe enjoy a rebound in 2025 from their current depressed levels, an innovative new meme coin called Meme Index (MEMEX) might be the best crypto to buy now . Meme Index (MEMEX) launched in December 2024 and has been creating massive early buzz as it sets out to revolutionize meme coin investing with diversified indices. The project has attracted significant interest, raising over $3.5 million, with investors intrigued by its plans to offer indices like Titan, Moonshot, and Frenzy, catering to various meme coin investing risk appetites. The token‚Äôs potential for strong performance in 2025 is supported by high staking rewards (up to 650% APY) encouraging retention, and a governance model allowing community input on index composition. If meme coins flourish during a crypto bull run, Meme Index‚Äôs strategy could yield notable returns. title: 2 More U.S. Regulatory Dominos May Have Fallen for Crypto: OCC and CFPB
body: The crypto industry can likely look forward to two more agencies falling into line on its digital assets policy aims: the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, which is one of the chief U.S. banking regulators, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, where the lights are effectively being shut off. The sector's dicey relationship with U.S. banking can be expected to be further mitigated with the arrival of a new stand-in chief at the OCC, Rodney Hood, the crypto-friendly former chairman of the U.S. credit-union watchdog. As with other key financial oversight positions, President Donald Trump has tapped somebody who embraces cryptocurrency technology. When running the credit-union agency in 2021, he'd said, "Cryptocurrency needs to be a part of the credit union system. If you don‚Äôt have it, it's going to hurt your ability to compete with other financial services providers." Substituting banks for credit unions in that sentiment could mean a rethinking of the OCC's guidance to banks in 2021 that contributed to the rift between crypto firms and U.S. banking services. The main thrust of the 2021 guidance from the OCC, Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. and the Federal Reserve was that banks shouldn't get into crypto business without getting a formal sign-off from their regulators that the products or services could be handled without risking the institution. But the industry has argued that the resistance from the agencies went even farther than that and pushed banks away from digital assets entirely. Trump's new acting head of the FDIC, Travis Hill, has already said he's ordered "a comprehensive review of all supervisory communications with banks that sought to offer crypto-related products or services" with the aim of opening a path for banks to engage with digital assets . With the removal , also, of the Securities and Exchange Commission's crypto accounting policy that effectively piled additional capital requirements on banks that wanted to handle crypto for clients, the banking impediments for digital assets may be falling away. Read More: Crypto's U.S. Banking Problem Likely Among the First Things Tackled Under Trump At the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the watchdog established after the global financial meltdown in 2008, is seeing its very existence under assault from Republicans who have long had issues with the agency's fights with corporations. Trump installed his budget chief, Russ Vought, as the acting head of CFPB, and he's moved to choke off its financing and cripple its operations. A cheer went up from certain figures in crypto, including Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase. His company was a frequent subject of consumer complaints logged on the agency's database ‚Äî almost 8,000 at last count . Armstrong said in a post on social media site X that the agency "should be deleted, " calling it an unconstitutional "activist organization that has done enormous harm to the country." (Though the U.S. Supreme Court ruled last year that the CFPB's operation doesn't run afoul of the Constitution.) Apart from what past leadership saw as its duty to protect consumers harmed by crypto firms, the agency was also seeking some additional policy authority over the industry. In January, its now-dismissed previous director pushed for a stablecoin regulation that the industry felt was an overreach that also threatened self-hosted wallets. But the proposal is unlikely to move further now that the agency's activity has been frozen in the Trump administration. The administration's CFPB attack has drawn resistance from Democratic lawmakers, including Senator Elizabeth Warren, the top Democrat on the Senate Banking Committee, and Representative Maxine Waters, who occupies that same role at the House Financial Services Committee. "Elon Musk and the guy who wrote Project 2025, Russ Vought, are trying to kill the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau," Warren said in a video released on Monday , criticizing Trump's administration for its pursuit of the consumer agency. "This is the payoff to the rich guys who invested in his campaign and who want to cheat families ‚Äî and not have anybody around to stop them." Democrats intend to hold a rally at the CFPB later Monday afternoon. Also on Monday, Waters released the text of the stablecoin bill she'd worked out with her previous Republican counterpart on the committee, former Chairman Patrick McHenry. This more bipartisan compromise effort, though, isn't what's currently on offer from Republicans. However, if both chambers eventually seek a bipartisan agreement on stablecoins that can comfortably pass muster in the Senate, it may have to address Democrats' concern about giving the states a high level of supervisory authority over stablecoin issuers.
tags: News Analysis|Consumer Financial Protection Bureau|Office of the Comptroller of the Currency|Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation|Elizabeth Warren|Maxine Waters|Elon Musk

title: DeepSeek AI names the two cryptocurrencies that will win in 2025
body: The early months of 2025 have been marked by heightened volatility fueled by geopolitical and economic uncertainty. China‚Äôs DeepSeek artificial intelligence ( AI ) model has contributed to a major downturn , while President Donald Trump‚Äôs latest tariff policies have further rattled both traditional finance and the cryptocurrency sector. With investor sentiment shifting rapidly, traders are searching for cryptocurrencies that can withstand economic turbulence and deliver strong returns. To evaluate its predictive capabilities, Finbold tasked DeepSeek AI with identifying the digital assets best positioned to win in 2025‚Äîthose expected to maintain dominance and thrive despite market uncertainty. DeepSeek AI names two cryptocurrencies that will win in 2025 With its online functionality and DeepThink (R1) enabled DeepSeek AI quickly identified Bitcoin ( BTC ) as its top pick, citing its market dominance and strong institutional backing. However, when asked to highlight other high-potential assets, the AI model picked Ethereum ( ETH ) and Solana ( SOL ), pointing to ecosystem growth, surging institutional interest, and favorable market conditions as key drivers of their strong growth potential in 2025. DeepSeek AI‚Äôs verdict. Source: DeepSeekAI/Finbold Ethereum (ETH) Currently trading at $2,687.75, with a one-day gain of 2.2%, Ethereum‚Äôs bullish momentum is gaining traction ahead of the highly anticipated Pectra upgrade scheduled for March 2025. Ethereum one-day price chart. Source: Finbold This upgrade is expected to enhance Ethereum‚Äôs scalability, transaction speeds, and cost efficiency. Test runs on Ethereum‚Äôs Sepolia and Holesky networks are already underway, and a successful rollout could attract more developers, driving increased demand for ETH. Institutional interest in Ethereum is also surging. According to CoinShares‚Äô February 10 report , Ethereum exchange-traded products (ETPs) absorbed $793 million in inflows over the past trading week, surpassing Bitcoin‚Äôs $407 million for the first time this year. The sharp increase in inflows, representing a 95% lead over Bitcoin, indicates that institutional investors are aggressively accumulating ETH, particularly following its recent dip near $2,100, a classic buy-on-weakness trend. While DeepSeek AI recognizes Ethereum‚Äôs dominance in NFTs and DeFi, technical indicators also project a strong bullish outlook, with projections as high as $10,000 this cycle, reinforcing its position as a top-performing asset in 2025. Solana (SOL) Solana is emerging as one of the top-performing cryptocurrencies in 2025, with technical and fundamental projections signaling a significant upside. Currently trading at $202.99, SOL is gaining traction as investors bet on its expanding market presence and increasing adoption. Solana one-day price chart. Source: Finbold Investment firm VanEck projects Solana could reach $520 by 2025, citing its growing market share in the smart contract platform (SCP) sector, which is expected to rise from 15% to 22% by year-end. Additionally, rising developer activity, increased decentralized exchange ( DEX ) trading volumes, and a growing user base further bolster Solana‚Äôs bullish outlook. Regulatory tailwinds are also fueling optimism. The SEC‚Äôs acknowledgment of Grayscale‚Äôs Solana ETF filing has heightened speculation about potential institutional inflows, which could accelerate Solana‚Äôs mainstream adoption. With a strong ecosystem and institutional backing, DeepSeek AI sees Solana as a key contender for 2025‚Äôs top-performing digital assets. While Ethereum and Solana are projected as high-potential cryptocurrencies for 2025, their path to success remains uncertain. Market volatility, regulatory developments, and broader economic conditions could influence their trajectory, making price fluctuations inevitable. As a result, investors should approach these assets with a long-term perspective and a strong risk management strategy, ensuring they are prepared for both opportunities and challenges in the evolving crypto landscape. title: $1,359,551,620 in Bitcoin (BTC) Suddenly Moves After 7-10 Years of Dormancy: CryptoQuant
body: A massive trove of Bitcoin that has been dormant for up to a decade has suddenly woken up and moved out of its wallet. Blockchain analytics firm CryptoQuant reports that 14,000 coins ‚Äì worth about $1.35 billion at time of writing ‚Äì were transferred early on Monday to new wallets. According to CryptoQuant, the BTC was not moved to exchanges, suggesting that the entity isn‚Äôt planning on selling their coins. ‚ÄúOn February 10th, 14,000 Bitcoins that had been inactive for 7 to 10 years were moved. Despite the large volume, these coins have not been transferred to any exchanges, suggesting that they are not intended for immediate sale. This kind of movement does not necessarily mean that Bitcoin‚Äôs price will drop. In the past, similar cases have occurred, but they did not always lead to a price decline. It would be wise to review historical data on Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements following such events (refer to the second indicator). However, it‚Äôs important to note that the average acquisition price of these coins is quite low, which could influence the holders‚Äô future decisions regarding potential sales.‚Äù Source: CryptoQuant CryptoQuant CEO Ki Young Ju recently said that the Bitcoin bull market still had legs, and likely wouldn‚Äôt top out until demand for ETFs tapered off. ‚ÄúThe Bitcoin bull cycle isn‚Äôt over. The buying engine for paper Bitcoins is still running. In 2021, the downturn came two months after GBTC (Grayscale Bitcoin Trust) inflows dried up. title: Ripple Lawsuit To End Before XRP ETF Approval, Says Jeremy Hogan
body: As anticipation builds for the XRP ETF launch, the crypto community is equally eager for the Ripple lawsuit settlement. While these monumental events are poised to revolutionize the crypto landscape, their arrival timeline remains shrouded in uncertainty. Meanwhile, attorney Jeremy Hogan remains optimistic that the Ripple lawsuit will reach a resolution before the XRP ETF approval. Jeremy Hogan Predicts Ripple Lawsuit End Ahead of XRP ETF Approval While more and more asset managers are expressing interest in launching an XRP ETF, there are ambiguities surrounding the Ripple lawsuit settlement. Many wonder if the SEC could greenlight the ETF launch while the prolonged lawsuit remains unresolved. However, legal expert Jeremy Hogan, in an X post , posited that the XRP lawsuit is likely to be resolved ahead of the potential launch of an ETF. Jeremy Hogan‚Äôs remarks were prompted by a question from the XRP community regarding the timeline of the Ripple lawsuit settlement and XRP ETF approval. When an XRP user asked which event would occur first, he stated, ‚ÄúMuch more likely the case is settled sooner than the ETF approvals.‚Äù This follows Nasdaq‚Äôs 19b-4 applications for CoinShares‚Äô XRP and Litecoin ETFs. Institutional Interest Rises: Will SEC Greenlight XRP ETF? Asset manager Grayscale Investments filed a 19b-4 form with the NYSE to convert its existing XRP Trust into an ETF. Similarly, CBOE BZX Exchange submitted the 19b-4 applications to launch XRP ETFs for asset managers like Bitwise, Canary Capital, 21Shares and WisdomTree. Significantly, the approval of the ETF while the Ripple lawsuit is still pending remains uncertain. However, the community remains optimistic about both events. Despite XRP‚Äôs legal war with the SEC, Bitget COO Vugar Usi Zade, stated, ‚ÄúXRP holds a unique position among altcoins due to its partial legal clarity in the US.‚Äù Ripple Lawsuit or XRP ETF- Which Will Come First? Despite Ripple‚Äôs partial victories against the SEC, the long-held lawsuit hasn‚Äôt found an ultimate end. This creates anxiety among the community members, especially surrounding the potential XRP ETF launch. Jeremy Hogan has corroborated the widely-held belief that an ETF launch could occur only after the Ripple lawsuit is resolved. However, clarifying his statement, Jeremy Hogan stated, ‚ÄúNot because it has to happen in that order, but because the ETFs will just take longer to dot the i‚Äôs and cross the t‚Äôs.‚Äù His words highlight the possible delay in the SEC‚Äôs approval of the Ripple ETF. Expanding on his point, Jeremy Hogan estimated that the ETF approval process could take up to 12 months. Community Awaits Paul Atkins‚Äô Leadership Since Donald Trump‚Äôs appointment of Paul Atkins as the SEC Chair, the XRP community has been anticipating a regulatory overhaul. While Mark Uyeda is the Acting Chair at present, the community awaits Paul Atkins‚Äô takeover as the SEC Chair. Ripple‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, believes that the new SEC Chair could bring a conclusion to the Ripple lawsuit. He posited that the restructured SEC could tackle the issue of enforced regulation. He added, ‚ÄúI remain cautiously optimistic that at some point during 2025, the case will be voluntarily withdrawn.‚Äù Addressing speculation about Paul Atkins‚Äô potential takeover, Fox Business reporter Eleanor Terrett highlighted the lengthy process involved in his appointment. In addition, she unveiled the lengthy procedures involved in the ETF approval. The post Ripple Lawsuit To End Before XRP ETF Approval, Says Jeremy Hogan appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Pump.fun Co-Founder Alon Cohen Denies Rumors That Project Is Launching Own Native Token
body: Pump.fun co-founder Alon Cohen is denying reports that the Solana ( SOL )-based memecoin launchpad will issue its own native token. Crypto reporter Colin Wu earlier said that Pump.fun is working on launching its own token and plans to use the Dutch auction system in the public offerings. Wu said that his team confirmed the information with insiders from multiple centralized exchanges (CEXs) that Pump.fun is purportedly working with to develop the system. In response, Cohen says on the social media platform X that the speculations are not true. He also tells his followers not to believe in anything that did not directly come from Pump.fun. ‚ÄúSeeing rumors about a potential pump fun token ‚Äì these are wrong‚Ä¶ While the Pump.fun team has mainly been focused on improving the product in its one-year history, the team has always been committed to rewarding its users properly. Good things take time!‚Äù But Wu stands by his report, saying he has proof to support the claim. ‚ÄúIt is almost a public fact that Pump.fun plan to issue token using the Dutch auction inside the CEXs‚Ä¶ Wu Blockchain Team obtained the detailed coin issuance preparation documents that Pump.fun provided to the CEXs. We can also publish with permission. The listing staff of multiple exchanges also confirmed to us that Pump.fun plans to issue a token. But the time is indeed not determined.‚Äù Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Metaplanet to acquire 21,000 Bitcoins worth $2 billion amid today‚Äôs stock surge
body: Metaplanet, Japan‚Äôs top Bitcoin treasury company, will acquire 21,000 Bitcoins worth about $2 billion by the end of 2026. The Tokyo-based company announced its 2025-2026 Bitcoin Plan today, doubling down on its status as a top corporate Bitcoin holder. Metaplanet plans to buy 10,000 Bitcoins by the end of 2025 before expanding its holdings to 21,000 in 2026. CEO Simon Gerovich said this is part of their goal to build the world‚Äôs largest Bitcoin reserve as if Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy) doesn‚Äôt exist. But Metaplanet is coming off a record year too, fueled by its switch to a ‚ÄúBitcoin-first‚Äù strategy in April 2024. Like Strategy, Metaplanet abandoned traditional performance benchmarks and now measures its success by the growth of its Bitcoin holdings. Metaplanet‚Äôs 21,000 BTC decision comes amid a surge in demand triggered by US President Donald Trump‚Äôs pro-crypto policies and the changes in Japan‚Äôs investment atmosphere. The price of Bitcoin itself hit a record high of $109,241 on January 20, as Trump took office. A year of explosive growth By December 31, 2024, Metaplanet held 1,761 Bitcoins, bought at an average price of ¬•11.85 million per coin. Those holdings have already exploded in value, surpassing ¬•27.7 billion ($206 million). The company‚Äôs Bitcoin strategy saw incredible gains last year, with a 309.82% Bitcoin yield in Q4 alone, compared to 41.7% in Q3. Metaplanet‚Äôs market capitalization skyrocketed by 7,000% in 2024, and its stock trading volume jumped by 430 times in yen terms. Metaplanet‚Äôs shareholder base grew by 500% last year, now surpassing 50,000 investors. This puts the company among the top 15 publicly traded companies holding Bitcoin globally. Much of Metaplanet‚Äôs stock performance is tied to Japan‚Äôs embrace of Bitcoin. Shares of the company have surged over 4,000% in the past 12 months, making it the biggest gainer on the Japanese stock market and one of the top-performing stocks globally. The mechanics behind the 21,000-Bitcoin plan The new plan, known as the ‚Äú21 Million Plan,‚Äù will be financed through the issuance of 21 million shares via moving strike warrants. Metaplanet is targeting ¬•116.65 billion ($870 million) in capital, and according to the official announcement, what‚Äôs unique about this strategy is the way it protects shareholders. Traditional equity raises in Japan often dilute shareholder value by issuing shares at discounted prices, but Metaplanet claims its warrants will be tied to 100% of the previous day‚Äôs closing price, so they can make sure that new shares aren‚Äôt getting sold below market value. Dylan LeClair, Metaplanet‚Äôs Director of Bitcoin Strategy, said the company‚Äôs focus is maximizing Bitcoin per share without disrupting the market. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve designed this plan to protect our shareholders,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe have the flexibility to pause or resume share issuance depending on Bitcoin market conditions.‚Äù Metaplanet CEO Gerovich admitted he drew inspiration from Strategy CEO Michael Saylor after hearing him on a podcast. Metaplanet was previously known as Red Planet Japan, and it was a hotel developer until the COVID-19 pandemic decimated the hospitality industry. Forced to close all but one of its hotels in early 2024, Metaplanet decided to adopt Bitcoin as its main business focus. By pouring 100% of its capital from rights issues and debt into Bitcoin, the company generated massive shareholder returns. Investors like Capital Group‚Äîalso a major backer of Strategy‚Äîjumped on board. But most of Metaplanet‚Äôs investors are retail traders, many of whom have limited experience with crypto assets. title: Berachain Backlash Sparks Debate Over Low Float, High FDV Token Model
body: Layer 1 Berachain's recent mainnet and token airdrop has ignited a debate within the cryptocurrency community, centering on the prevalent low float, high fully diluted valuation (FDV) token model. BERA, designed to function as the network's primary utility token, saw an initial surge of 71% following its airdrop, reaching a peak of $14.83, or $1.4 billion market capitalization, within hours, according to CoinGecko. However, it has since dropped 63%, now trading at $5.51 and a market cap of $589 million. A key point of contention surrounding BERA is its token allocation. Out of the total 500 million supply at genesis, approximately 79 million tokens (or around 15%) were designated for the airdrop.
